DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Use Negation Pharmacologic Substance Intervention or Procedure For Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to information for the concomitant use of non-pharmacologic interventions for chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Use Negation Pharmacologic Substance Intervention or Procedure For Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._The reason of something._Any disorder affecting the peripheral nerves resulting from exposure to chemotherapeutic agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Property.preferredName: Negation Pharmacologic Substance Intervention or Procedure For Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:The reason of something.:Any disorder affecting the peripheral nerves resulting from exposure to chemotherapeutic agents.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Any disorder affecting the peripheral nerves resulting from exposure to chemotherapeutic agents.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
